(despite what all the timestamps might say because they're lying)

blog.title: Sewing is Pointless
blog.body: At some point a month ago or something, I tried to figure out who could actually use sewing, and it turns out there isn't really much of a market. Since clothes are so mass produceable, it's usually easier to just buy them instead. It's kind of a remnant of the yonder years, back before sewing machines. UNLESS, you're a teenager who does not have a job and thus have to rely on your parents to buy clothes for you, then you have a reason, because it's a lot easier to convince them to buy fabric than it is to convince them to buy some random shirt.
